document.masterDocTitle: A recent inventory of the bats of Mozambique with documentation of seven new species for the country

subSubSection.paragraph:
A single specimen assigned to this species was collected just south of the Niassa Game Reserve, northern Mozambique . Although it matched
R. simulator
in most characters (including cranial measurements — Table 2 ), the anterior upper premolar was tiny and mostly outside the toothrow (inside toothrow in
R. simulator
) and the ear length was 17 mm which is extremely short for this species. Due to technical difficulties its echolocation call could not be recorded.
Field measurements: FA (adult male) 42.4 (1); Bm (adult male) 6 (1). Nose-leaf width was 7.8 for the single male.
